refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: You may wish to begin by reading the text widget conceptual overview which gives an overview of all the objects and data types related to the text widget and how they work together.
Tags should be in the GtkTextTagTable for a given GtkTextBuffer before using them with that buffer.
gtk_text_buffer_create_tag() is the best way to create tags. See gtk-demo for numerous examples.
The "invisible" property was not implemented for GTK+ 2.0; it's planned to be implemented in future releases.

refsect2.title: enum GtkWrapMode
refsect2.para: Describes a type of line wrapping.

listitem.simpara: do not wrap lines; just make the text area wider
wrap text, breaking lines anywhere the cursor can appear (between characters, usually - if you want to be technical, between graphemes, see pango_get_log_attrs())
wrap text, breaking lines in between words
wrap text, breaking lines in between words, or if that is not enough, also between graphemes.

refsect2.title: GtkTextAttributes
refsect2.para: Using GtkTextAttributes directly should rarely be necessary. It's primarily useful with gtk_text_iter_get_attributes(). As with most GTK+ structs, the fields in this struct should only be read, never modified directly.

listitem.simpara: pointer to sub-struct containing certain attributes

refsect2.title: gtk_text_tag_new ()
refsect2.para: Creates a GtkTextTag. Configure the tag using object arguments, i.e. using g_object_set().

refsect2.title: gtk_text_tag_set_priority ()
refsect2.para: Sets the priority of a GtkTextTag. Valid priorities are start at 0 and go to one less than gtk_text_tag_table_get_size(). Each tag in a table has a unique priority; setting the priority of one tag shifts the priorities of all the other tags in the table to maintain a unique priority for each tag. Higher priority tags "win" if two tags both set the same text attribute. When adding a tag to a tag table, it will be assigned the highest priority in the table by default; so normally the precedence of a set of tags is the order in which they were added to the table, or created with gtk_text_buffer_create_tag(), which adds the tag to the buffer's table automatically.

refsect2.title: GtkTextAppearance
gtk_text_attributes_new ()
refsect2.para: Creates a GtkTextAttributes, which describes a set of properties on some text.

refsect2.title: gtk_text_attributes_copy ()
refsect2.para: Copies src and returns a new GtkTextAttributes.

refsect2.title: gtk_text_attributes_copy_values ()
refsect2.para: Copies the values from src to dest so that dest has the same values as src. Frees existing values in dest.

refsect2.title: gtk_text_attributes_unref ()
refsect2.para: Decrements the reference count on values, freeing the structure if the reference count reaches 0.

refsect2.title: gtk_text_attributes_ref ()
refsect2.para: Increments the reference count on values.

listitem.simpara: the GtkTextAttributes that were passed in

refsect2.title: The "background-full-height" property
refsect2.para: Whether the background color fills the entire line height or only the height of the tagged characters.

refsect2.title: The "background-full-height-set" property
refsect2.para: Whether this tag affects background height.

refsect2.title: The "background-gdk" property
refsect2.para: Background color as a (possibly unallocated) GdkColor.

refsect2.title: The "background-set" property
refsect2.para: Whether this tag affects the background color.

refsect2.title: The "background-stipple" property
refsect2.para: Bitmap to use as a mask when drawing the text background.

refsect2.title: The "background-stipple-set" property
refsect2.para: Whether this tag affects the background stipple.

refsect2.title: The "direction" property
refsect2.para: Text direction, e.g. right-to-left or left-to-right.

refsect2.title: The "editable" property
refsect2.para: Whether the text can be modified by the user.

refsect2.title: The "editable-set" property
refsect2.para: Whether this tag affects text editability.

refsect2.title: The "family" property
refsect2.para: Name of the font family, e.g. Sans, Helvetica, Times, Monospace.

refsect2.title: The "family-set" property
refsect2.para: Whether this tag affects the font family.

refsect2.title: The "font" property
refsect2.para: Font description as string, e.g. \"Sans Italic 12\".
Note that the initial value of this property depends on the internals of PangoFontDescription.

refsect2.title: The "font-desc" property
refsect2.para: Font description as a PangoFontDescription struct.

refsect2.title: The "foreground-gdk" property
refsect2.para: Foreground color as a (possibly unallocated) GdkColor.

refsect2.title: The "foreground-set" property
refsect2.para: Whether this tag affects the foreground color.

refsect2.title: The "foreground-stipple" property
refsect2.para: Bitmap to use as a mask when drawing the text foreground.

refsect2.title: The "foreground-stipple-set" property
refsect2.para: Whether this tag affects the foreground stipple.

refsect2.title: The "indent" property
refsect2.para: Amount to indent the paragraph, in pixels.

refsect2.title: The "invisible" property
refsect2.para: Note that there may still be problems with the support for invisible text, in particular when navigating programmatically inside a buffer containing invisible segments.

refsect2.title: The "invisible-set" property
refsect2.para: Whether this tag affects text visibility.

refsect2.title: The "justification-set" property
refsect2.para: Whether this tag affects paragraph justification.

refsect2.title: The "language" property
refsect2.para: The language this text is in, as an ISO code. Pango can use this as a hint when rendering the text. If not set, an appropriate default will be used.
Note that the initial value of this property depends on the current locale, see also gtk_get_default_language().

refsect2.title: The "language-set" property
refsect2.para: Whether this tag affects the language the text is rendered as.

refsect2.title: The "left-margin" property
refsect2.para: Width of the left margin in pixels.

refsect2.title: The "left-margin-set" property
refsect2.para: Whether this tag affects the left margin.

refsect2.title: The "name" property
refsect2.para: Name used to refer to the text tag. NULL for anonymous tags.

refsect2.title: The "paragraph-background" property
refsect2.para: The paragraph background color as a string.

refsect2.title: The "paragraph-background-gdk" property
refsect2.para: The paragraph background color as a as a (possibly unallocated) GdkColor.

refsect2.title: The "paragraph-background-set" property
refsect2.para: Whether this tag affects the paragraph background color.

refsect2.title: The "pixels-above-lines" property
refsect2.para: Pixels of blank space above paragraphs.

refsect2.title: The "pixels-above-lines-set" property
refsect2.para: Whether this tag affects the number of pixels above lines.

refsect2.title: The "pixels-below-lines" property
refsect2.para: Pixels of blank space below paragraphs.

refsect2.title: The "pixels-below-lines-set" property
refsect2.para: Whether this tag affects the number of pixels above lines.

refsect2.title: The "pixels-inside-wrap" property
refsect2.para: Pixels of blank space between wrapped lines in a paragraph.

refsect2.title: The "pixels-inside-wrap-set" property
refsect2.para: Whether this tag affects the number of pixels between wrapped lines.

refsect2.title: The "right-margin" property
refsect2.para: Width of the right margin in pixels.

refsect2.title: The "right-margin-set" property
refsect2.para: Whether this tag affects the right margin.

refsect2.title: The "rise" property
refsect2.para: Offset of text above the baseline (below the baseline if rise is negative) in Pango units.

refsect2.title: The "rise-set" property
refsect2.para: Whether this tag affects the rise.

refsect2.title: The "scale" property
refsect2.para: Font size as a scale factor relative to the default font size. This properly adapts to theme changes etc. so is recommended. Pango predefines some scales such as PANGO_SCALE_X_LARGE.

refsect2.title: The "scale-set" property
refsect2.para: Whether this tag scales the font size by a factor.

refsect2.title: The "size-set" property
refsect2.para: Whether this tag affects the font size.

refsect2.title: The "stretch" property
refsect2.para: Font stretch as a PangoStretch, e.g. PANGO_STRETCH_CONDENSED.

refsect2.title: The "stretch-set" property
refsect2.para: Whether this tag affects the font stretch.

refsect2.title: The "strikethrough" property
refsect2.para: Whether to strike through the text.

refsect2.title: The "style" property
refsect2.para: Font style as a PangoStyle, e.g. PANGO_STYLE_ITALIC.

refsect2.title: The "style-set" property
refsect2.para: Whether this tag affects the font style.

refsect2.title: The "underline" property
refsect2.para: Style of underline for this text.

refsect2.title: The "variant" property
refsect2.para: Font variant as a PangoVariant, e.g. PANGO_VARIANT_SMALL_CAPS.

refsect2.title: The "variant-set" property
refsect2.para: Whether this tag affects the font variant.

refsect2.title: The "weight" property
refsect2.para: Font weight as an integer, see predefined values in PangoWeight; for example, PANGO_WEIGHT_BOLD.

refsect2.title: The "weight-set" property
refsect2.para: Whether this tag affects the font weight.

refsect2.title: The "wrap-mode" property
refsect2.para: Whether to wrap lines never, at word boundaries, or at character boundaries.

refsect2.title: The "wrap-mode-set" property
refsect2.para: Whether this tag affects line wrap mode.
